title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Català M (2025). OmopDatasets: Dataset Manager OMOP Common Data Model Sample Datasets. R package version 0.1.0, https://oxford-pharmacoepi.github.io/OmopDatasets/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {OmopDatasets: Dataset Manager for OMOP Common Data Model Sample Datasets},   author = {Martí Català},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://oxford-pharmacoepi.github.io/OmopDatasets/}, }

what: Dataset Manager for OMOP Common Data Model Sample Datasets
title: Dataset Manager for OMOP Common Data Model Sample Datasets
Dataset Manager for OMOP Common Data Model Sample Datasets
text: can install OmopDatasets cran: can install development version OmopDatasets GitHub :
code: install.packages("OmopDatasets") # install.packages("pak") pak::pkg_install("oxford-pharmacoepi/OmopDatasets")

title: Dataset Manager for OMOP Common Data Model Sample Datasets
text: simple example start working one synthetic OMOP CDM Datasets: Choose dataset want use list availableDatasets(): Download dataset interested :
code: availableDatasets() downloadDataset(datasetName = "GiBleed")

title: Dataset Manager for OMOP Common Data Model Sample Datasets
code: cdm <- cdmFromDataset(datasetName = "GiBleed") cdm

title: Dataset Manager for OMOP Common Data Model Sample Datasets
code: connectionDetails <- connectionDetailsFromDataset(datasetName = "GiBleed") connectionDetails

what: OmopDatasets: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case) — OmopDatasets-package
title: OmopDatasets: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case) — OmopDatasets-package
OmopDatasets: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case) — OmopDatasets-package
List the available datasets — availableDatasets
List the available datasets — availableDatasets
code: availableDatasets()

title: List the available datasets — availableDatasets
List the available datasets — availableDatasets
code: library(OmopDatasets)  availableDatasets() #>  [1] "GiBleed"                             "synthea-allergies-10k"               #>  [3] "synthea-anemia-10k"                  "synthea-breast_cancer-10k"           #>  [5] "synthea-contraceptives-10k"          "synthea-covid19-10k"                 #>  [7] "synthea-covid19-200k"                "synthea-dermatitis-10k"              #>  [9] "synthea-heart-10k"                   "synthea-hiv-10k"                     #> [11] "synthea-lung_cancer-10k"             "synthea-medications-10k"             #> [13] "synthea-metabolic_syndrome-10k"      "synthea-opioid_addiction-10k"        #> [15] "synthea-rheumatoid_arthritis-10k"    "synthea-snf-10k"                     #> [17] "synthea-surgery-10k"                 "synthea-total_joint_replacement-10k" #> [19] "synthea-veteran_prostate_cancer-10k" "synthea-veterans-10k"                #> [21] "synthea-weight_loss-10k"             "synpuf-1k_5.3"                       #> [23] "synpuf-1k_5.4"                       "empty_cdm"

what: Create a duckdb cdm_reference from a dataset. — cdmFromDataset
title: Create a duckdb cdm_reference from a dataset. — cdmFromDataset
text: Note temporal cdm objects accessible disconnecting, want create duckdb database use exportDatasetToDuckdb().

title: Create a duckdb cdm_reference from a dataset. — cdmFromDataset
code: cdmFromDataset(   datasetName = "GiBleed",   cdmSchema = "main",   cdmPrefix = "",   writeSchema = "main",   writePrefix = "" )

title: Create a duckdb cdm_reference from a dataset. — cdmFromDataset
text: datasetName Name dataset. See availableDatasets() possibilities. cdmSchema string indicates cdm schema. cdmPrefix string prefixes tables cdm schema. writeSchema string indicates write schema. writePrefix string prefixes tables write schema.

title: Create a duckdb cdm_reference from a dataset. — cdmFromDataset
Create a duckdb cdm_reference from a dataset. — cdmFromDataset
code: library(OmopDatasets)  datasetsFolder(tempdir()) #> ℹ If you want to create a permanent `OMOP_DATASETS_FOLDER` write the following #>   in your `.Renviron` file: #>  #>   OMOP_DATASETS_FOLDER="/tmp/RtmpLb0spH" downloadDataset(datasetName = "GiBleed") cdm <- cdmFromDataset(datasetName = "GiBleed") cdm #>  #> ── # OMOP CDM reference (duckdb) of GiBleed ──────────────────────────────────── #> • omop tables: person, observation_period, visit_occurrence, visit_detail, #> condition_occurrence, drug_exposure, procedure_occurrence, device_exposure, #> measurement, observation, death, note, note_nlp, specimen, fact_relationship, #> location, care_site, provider, payer_plan_period, cost, drug_era, dose_era, #> condition_era, metadata, cdm_source, concept, vocabulary, domain, #> concept_class, concept_relationship, relationship, concept_synonym, #> concept_ancestor, source_to_concept_map, drug_strength #> • cohort tables: - #> • achilles tables: - #> • other tables: -

what: Create a cdm_reference object from a METADATA file. — cdmFromMetadata
title: Create a cdm_reference object from a METADATA file. — cdmFromMetadata
Create a cdm_reference object from a METADATA file. — cdmFromMetadata
code: cdmFromMetadata(path)

title: Create a cdm_reference object from a METADATA file. — cdmFromMetadata
Create a cdm_reference object from a METADATA file. — cdmFromMetadata
Create a cdm_reference object from a METADATA file. — cdmFromMetadata
code: library(OmopDatasets)  datasetsFolder(tempdir()) #> ℹ If you want to create a permanent `OMOP_DATASETS_FOLDER` write the following #>   in your `.Renviron` file: #>  #>   OMOP_DATASETS_FOLDER="/tmp/RtmpLb0spH" downloadDataset(datasetName = "GiBleed") pathToExport <- file.path(tempdir(), "myDatabase") dir.create(pathToExport) exportDatasetToDuckdb(path = pathToExport, datasetName = "GiBleed")  cdm <- cdmFromMetadata(path = pathToExport) cdm #>  #> ── # OMOP CDM reference (duckdb) of GiBleed ──────────────────────────────────── #> • omop tables: person, observation_period, visit_occurrence, visit_detail, #> condition_occurrence, drug_exposure, procedure_occurrence, device_exposure, #> measurement, observation, death, note, note_nlp, specimen, fact_relationship, #> location, care_site, provider, payer_plan_period, cost, drug_era, dose_era, #> condition_era, metadata, cdm_source, concept, vocabulary, domain, #> concept_class, concept_relationship, relationship, concept_synonym, #> concept_ancestor, source_to_concept_map, drug_strength #> • cohort tables: - #> • achilles tables: - #> • other tables: -

Helper for consistent documentation of datasetName. — datasetNameDoc
text: datasetName Name dataset. See availableDatasets() possibilities.

Check the availability of the OMOP CDM datasets. — datasetStatus
code: datasetStatus()

title: Check the availability of the OMOP CDM datasets. — datasetStatus
Check the availability of the OMOP CDM datasets. — datasetStatus
code: datasetStatus() #> ✔ GiBleed #> ✖ empty_cdm #> ✖ synpuf-1k_5.3 #> ✖ synpuf-1k_5.4 #> ✖ synthea-allergies-10k #> ✖ synthea-anemia-10k #> ✖ synthea-breast_cancer-10k #> ✖ synthea-contraceptives-10k #> ✖ synthea-covid19-10k #> ✖ synthea-covid19-200k #> ✖ synthea-dermatitis-10k #> ✖ synthea-heart-10k #> ✖ synthea-hiv-10k #> ✖ synthea-lung_cancer-10k #> ✖ synthea-medications-10k #> ✖ synthea-metabolic_syndrome-10k #> ✖ synthea-opioid_addiction-10k #> ✖ synthea-rheumatoid_arthritis-10k #> ✖ synthea-snf-10k #> ✖ synthea-surgery-10k #> ✖ synthea-total_joint_replacement-10k #> ✖ synthea-veteran_prostate_cancer-10k #> ✖ synthea-veterans-10k #> ✖ synthea-weight_loss-10k

what: Check or set the datasets Folder — datasetsFolder
title: Check or set the datasets Folder — datasetsFolder
Check or set the datasets Folder — datasetsFolder
code: datasetsFolder(path = NULL)

title: Check or set the datasets Folder — datasetsFolder
text: path Path folder store synthetic datasets. NULL current OMOP_DATASETS_FOLDER returned.

title: Check or set the datasets Folder — datasetsFolder
Check or set the datasets Folder — datasetsFolder
code: # \donttest{ datasetsFolder() #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpLb0spH" datasetsFolder(file.path(getwd(), "OMOP_DATASETS")) #> ℹ Creating #>   /home/runner/work/OmopDatasets/OmopDatasets/docs/reference/OMOP_DATASETS. #> ℹ If you want to create a permanent `OMOP_DATASETS_FOLDER` write the following #>   in your `.Renviron` file: #>  #>   OMOP_DATASETS_FOLDER="/home/runner/work/OmopDatasets/OmopDatasets/docs/reference/OMOP_DATASETS" datasetsFolder() #> [1] "/home/runner/work/OmopDatasets/OmopDatasets/docs/reference/OMOP_DATASETS" # }

what: Download an OMOP Synthetic dataset. — downloadDataset
title: Download an OMOP Synthetic dataset. — downloadDataset
Download an OMOP Synthetic dataset. — downloadDataset
code: downloadDataset(   datasetName = "GiBleed",   path = datasetsFolder(),   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Download an OMOP Synthetic dataset. — downloadDataset
text: datasetName Name dataset. See availableDatasets() possibilities. path Path download dataset. overwrite Whether overwrite dataset already downloaded.

title: Download an OMOP Synthetic dataset. — downloadDataset
Download an OMOP Synthetic dataset. — downloadDataset
code: # \donttest{ library(OmopDatasets)  isDatasetDownloaded("GiBleed") #> [1] FALSE downloadDataset("GiBleed") isDatasetDownloaded("GiBleed") #> [1] TRUE # }

what: Export a dataset to a duckdb database — exportDatasetToDuckdb
title: Export a dataset to a duckdb database — exportDatasetToDuckdb
text: create permanent duckdb database can work locally connect disconnect using CDMConnector.

title: Export a dataset to a duckdb database — exportDatasetToDuckdb
code: exportDatasetToDuckdb(   path,   datasetName = "GiBleed",   cdmSchema = "main",   cdmPrefix = "",   writeSchema = "main",   writePrefix = "" )

title: Export a dataset to a duckdb database — exportDatasetToDuckdb
text: path Path export dataset create duckdb database. datasetName Name dataset. See availableDatasets() possibilities. cdmSchema string indicates cdm schema. cdmPrefix string prefixes tables cdm schema. writeSchema string indicates write schema. writePrefix string prefixes tables write schema.

title: Export a dataset to a duckdb database — exportDatasetToDuckdb
Export a dataset to a duckdb database — exportDatasetToDuckdb
code: library(OmopDatasets)  datasetsFolder(tempdir()) #> ℹ If you want to create a permanent `OMOP_DATASETS_FOLDER` write the following #>   in your `.Renviron` file: #>  #>   OMOP_DATASETS_FOLDER="/tmp/RtmpLb0spH" downloadDataset(datasetName = "GiBleed")  pathToExport <- file.path(tempdir(), "myDatabase") dir.create(pathToExport) #> Warning: '/tmp/RtmpLb0spH/myDatabase' already exists  exportDatasetToDuckdb(path = pathToExport, datasetName = "GiBleed") #> ℹ Deleting prior `METADATA` file. #> ℹ Deleting prior `duckdb` file. list.files(pathToExport) #> [1] "GiBleed.duckdb"     "GiBleed.duckdb.wal" "METADATA"

what: Export a dataset to files — exportDatasetToFiles
title: Export a dataset to files — exportDatasetToFiles
Export a dataset to files — exportDatasetToFiles
code: exportDatasetToFiles(path, datasetName = "GiBleed", format = "csv")

title: Export a dataset to files — exportDatasetToFiles
text: path Path export files . datasetName Name dataset. See availableDatasets() possibilities. format Either 'csv' 'parquet'.

title: Export a dataset to files — exportDatasetToFiles
Export a dataset to files — exportDatasetToFiles
code: library(OmopDatasets)  datasetsFolder(tempdir()) #> ℹ If you want to create a permanent `OMOP_DATASETS_FOLDER` write the following #>   in your `.Renviron` file: #>  #>   OMOP_DATASETS_FOLDER="/tmp/RtmpLb0spH" downloadDataset(datasetName = "GiBleed") pathToExport <- file.path(tempdir(), "myDatabase") dir.create(pathToExport) #> Warning: '/tmp/RtmpLb0spH/myDatabase' already exists  exportDatasetToFiles(   path = pathToExport,   datasetName = "GiBleed",   format = "csv" ) #> ℹ Deleting prior `METADATA` file. list.files(pathToExport) #>  [1] "GiBleed.duckdb"            "METADATA"                  #>  [3] "care_site.csv"             "cdm_source.csv"            #>  [5] "concept.csv"               "concept_ancestor.csv"      #>  [7] "concept_class.csv"         "concept_relationship.csv"  #>  [9] "concept_synonym.csv"       "condition_era.csv"         #> [11] "condition_occurrence.csv"  "cost.csv"                  #> [13] "death.csv"                 "device_exposure.csv"       #> [15] "domain.csv"                "dose_era.csv"              #> [17] "drug_era.csv"              "drug_exposure.csv"         #> [19] "drug_strength.csv"         "fact_relationship.csv"     #> [21] "location.csv"              "measurement.csv"           #> [23] "metadata.csv"              "note.csv"                  #> [25] "note_nlp.csv"              "observation.csv"           #> [27] "observation_period.csv"    "payer_plan_period.csv"     #> [29] "person.csv"                "procedure_occurrence.csv"  #> [31] "provider.csv"              "relationship.csv"          #> [33] "source_to_concept_map.csv" "specimen.csv"              #> [35] "visit_detail.csv"          "visit_occurrence.csv"      #> [37] "vocabulary.csv"

what: Check if a certain dataset is downloaded. — isDatasetDownloaded
title: Check if a certain dataset is downloaded. — isDatasetDownloaded
Check if a certain dataset is downloaded. — isDatasetDownloaded
code: isDatasetDownloaded(datasetName = "GiBleed", path = datasetsFolder())

title: Check if a certain dataset is downloaded. — isDatasetDownloaded
text: datasetName Name dataset. See availableDatasets() possibilities. path Path search dataset.

title: Check if a certain dataset is downloaded. — isDatasetDownloaded
Check if a certain dataset is downloaded. — isDatasetDownloaded
code: # \donttest{ library(OmopDatasets)  isDatasetDownloaded("GiBleed") #> [1] TRUE downloadDataset("GiBleed") isDatasetDownloaded("GiBleed") #> [1] TRUE # }

what: Available OMOP CDM Synthetic Datasets — omopDatasets
title: Available OMOP CDM Synthetic Datasets — omopDatasets
text: OMOP CDM Synthetic datasets available download using OmopDatasets package.

title: Available OMOP CDM Synthetic Datasets — omopDatasets
code: omopDatasets

title: Available OMOP CDM Synthetic Datasets — omopDatasets
text: data frame 4 variables: dataset_name Name dataset. url url download dataset. cdm_name Name cdm reference created. cdm_version OMOP CDM version dataset.

title: Available OMOP CDM Synthetic Datasets — omopDatasets
code: omopDatasets #> # A tibble: 24 × 4 #>    dataset_name               url                           cdm_name cdm_version #>    <chr>                      <chr>                         <chr>    <chr>       #>  1 GiBleed                    https://example-data.ohdsi.d… GiBleed  5.3         #>  2 synthea-allergies-10k      https://example-data.ohdsi.d… synthea… 5.3         #>  3 synthea-anemia-10k         https://example-data.ohdsi.d… synthea… 5.3         #>  4 synthea-breast_cancer-10k  https://example-data.ohdsi.d… synthea… 5.3         #>  5 synthea-contraceptives-10k https://example-data.ohdsi.d… synthea… 5.3         #>  6 synthea-covid19-10k        https://example-data.ohdsi.d… synthea… 5.3         #>  7 synthea-covid19-200k       https://example-data.ohdsi.d… synthea… 5.3         #>  8 synthea-dermatitis-10k     https://example-data.ohdsi.d… synthea… 5.3         #>  9 synthea-heart-10k          https://example-data.ohdsi.d… synthea… 5.3         #> 10 synthea-hiv-10k            https://example-data.ohdsi.d… synthea… 5.3         #> # ℹ 14 more rows
